Additionally, a smaller white vehicle is visible in the rightmost lane, displaying its brake lights as well and seeming to be either stationary or at a very low speed. Due to the wet-looking road conditions, the ego car should drive cautiously to prevent any loss of traction. Maintain a safe following distance from the large truck to ensure ample time to react to any sudden stops or turns. Also, stay alert for any signals from the vehicle that may indicate a turn or lane change. Consider the possibility to safely change lanes if the current lane remains slow-moving or blocked ahead, but only if the adjacent lanes are clear of traffic. Maintain a safe following distance from the large truck ahead, monitor the white SUV's position and speed for potential lane changing or merging, and adjust speed to account for the decreased visibility and potential for sudden stops due to the nighttime driving conditions.
